hints.content:
Every bill has a different value.

Dollar name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
One dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of one dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/526e9b19f2c39d0d908b6c531d510186f6e93e97.png) | $\$1$
Five dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of five dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/5069901d0226c2c5f1c3e73b2b5d7e48ee1e1eee.png) | $\$5$
Ten dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of ten dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/35b0286a92e1825d39af39b5e362e5d9674eb00d.png) | $\$10$
Twenty dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of twenty dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/66f0febd8ba41a0e3413f72b2f1fc2d54a3819de.png) | $\$20$

Let's label the value of each set of bills and find the total.

![3, ten dollar bills. 3, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f4cc4f6f228c0b8e6c5ec584fc2c719ae1d6b263.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} ++ \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{30}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$33
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$33$, so it is **not** equal to $\$43$.

![2, twenty dollar bills. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/234c6d44d0c4450f758afc2b6a2017f7c7a7ed76.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}}  +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{40}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} 
  +\underbrace{\$\blueE{2}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$42
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$42$, so it is **not** equal to $\$43$.

![1, twenty dollar bill. 2, ten dollar bills. 3, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/568455c19b0327241c74e921a1d417e13b17222b.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ twenty dollar bill}}}   + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10} +\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} +\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ twenty dollar bill}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\goldE{20}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$43
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$43$, so it **is** equal to Khalil's amount of money.

Khalil could have this set of bills:

![1, twenty dollar bill. 2, ten dollar bills. 3, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/568455c19b0327241c74e921a1d417e13b17222b.png)

question.content:
Khalil has $\$43$.

**Which set of bills could Khalil have?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![1, twenty dollar bill. 2, ten dollar bills. 3, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/568455c19b0327241c74e921a1d417e13b17222b.png)
